name: Iron
description: Excess iron in the body accelerates aging by producing free radicals that damage tissues and promote senescent cell accumulation.

name: AMPK
description: AMPK is a protein that acts as a cellular sensor to monitor energy levels and activate defense mechanisms against aging, such as mitochondrial biogenesis.

name: Mitochondria
description: Mitochondria are cellular powerhouses that generate energy and play a key role in aging and longevity. Exercise and hypoxia stimulate mitochondrial production.

name: Senescent Cells
description: Senescent cells, or 'zombie cells', contribute to aging and disease by secreting harmful chemicals. Exercise can reduce their numbers.

name: Adversity Mimetics
description: Adversity mimetics are practices, such as exercise, heat, and cold exposure, that simulate biological stress to activate survival and longevity genes.

name: Sirtuins
description: Sirtuins are proteins that help regulate cellular processes related to aging, including DNA repair and stress resistance.

name: Hyperbaric Oxygen Therapy (HBOT)
description: HBOT is an emerging therapy that mimics exercise-like benefits, including reversing telomere shortening and improving cognitive performance and longevity.

name: Exercise
description: Regular exercise, including both low-intensity and vigorous types, is crucial for health, aging prevention, and activating longevity genes.

name: Cold Therapy
description: Cold therapy triggers the production of brown fat, which is associated with metabolic health and longevity benefits.

name: Heat Therapy
description: Heat therapy, such as sauna use, activates heat shock proteins and promotes health benefits, including new blood vessel growth and improved mitochondrial function.
